Issues.Title: Angular 2 quick start : sample code is confusing for beginners
Issues.Body:
# üìö Docs or angular.io bug report

### Description

I think the following code is easy to cause confusion.

https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/d4c4a8943168eae9f7c70f25c42d7b5a6b5ccf8f/aio/content/examples/getting-started-v0/src/app/product-list/product-list.component.ts#L11

In the same variable range, the same variable name, but the first one is the attribute of class, and the last one is the variable that is imported.

I think to write directly to the contents of variables here, although not clean but easier to understand.

like this: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-rbgsj9?file=src%2Fapp%2Fproduct-list%2Fproduct-list.component.ts

Issues.Title: RFC: Use protected variables in HTML
Issues.Body:
<!--üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ

Oh hi there! üòÑ 

To expedite issue processing please search open and closed issues before submitting a new one.
Existing issues often contain information about workarounds, resolution, or progress updates.

üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ-->


# üöÄ feature request

### Relevant Package
This feature request is for `@angular/compiler-cli`


### Description
In order to access variables in HTML, we have to set variable's access level to `public`. This introduces plethora of problems. I can name few here:

Imagine, we create a variable `loginFormGroup` inside `.ts` file.
```typescript
  private loginFormGroup = new FormGroup({ username: new FormControl('') });
```
To hook into HTML, I have to change variable's access level to `public` which I don't want to do but I have to.
```html
<form [formGroup]="loginFormGroup">
...
</form>

```

- @ViewChild : If a parent component gets a reference to child componentInstance, the parent component can now modify all public properties and methods. This is fine except at times when it is not. 

Inside a parent component
```typescript
@ViewChild(ChildComponent) childComponent: ChildComponent;

// This formGroup is supposed to be internal üò°
// I don't want anybody to play with my loginFormGroup variable
this.childComponent.loginFormGroup.patchValue({username: 'Hacked'});
```

- Unit test
```typescript
  it('should enable login button if username is entered', () => {
    // Totally Wrong: loginFormGroup should not be accessible here
    // We should set username by accessing HTML Input control using CSS
    component.loginFormGroup.patchValue({
      username: 'John'
    });
    fixture.detectChanges();
    const loginButton = fixture.debugElement.query(By.css('.login-button'));
     expect(loginButton.nativeElement.disabled).toBe(false);
   });
```

### Describe the solution you'd like
We should be able to use variables in HTML without setting them to be `public`. We can consider `protected` access modifier however I am open to other suggestions.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "RFC: Use protected variables in HTML" (#29648)

Issues.Title: test(docs-infra): avoid click-related CI flake in e2e test
Issues.Body:
One of the tests introduced in #29601 is susceptible to a kind of WebDriver flake related to trying to click elements hidden behind fixed positioned elements.
This PR works around the issue by clicking the elements directly using JavaScript (instead of `WebElement#click()`).

(For reference, here is such a flake: [268227])

[268227]: https://circleci.com/gh/angular/angular/268227
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "test(docs-infra): avoid click-related CI flake in e2e test" (#29641)

Issues.Title: refactor(ivy): move instructions
Issues.Body:
- moves all publicly exported instructions to their own files
- refactors namespace instructions to set state in `state.ts`
- no longer exports * from `instructions.ts`.
- `instructions.ts` renamed to `shared.ts` (old `shared.ts` contents folded in to `instructions.ts`)
- updates `all.ts` to re-export from public instruction files.
- no functionality changed
- no functions renamed
- namespace-related code was the only refactor, everything else was just moving things around.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "refactor(ivy): move instructions" (#29646)

Issues.Title: build: Remove --watchfs from bazelrc file
Issues.Body:
--watchfs is causing the build to be flaky on Windows because Bazel
doesn't have proper support for watchfs on Windows, but it doesn't seem
to bring much performance on Linux, either.

Fixes: https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/29541

Issues.Title: fix(router): adjust setting navigationTransition when a new navigatio‚Ä¶
Issues.Body:
‚Ä¶n cancels an existing one

Prior to this change, if a navigation was ongoing and a new one came in, the router could get into a state where `router.currentNavigation` was `null` even though a navigation was executing. This change moves where we set the `currentNavigation` value so it's inside a `switchMap`. This solves the problem because the `finally` on the `switchMap` had been setting `currentNavigation` to `null` but the new `currentNavigation` value would have already been set. Essentially this was a timing problem and is resolved with this change.

Fixes #29389 #29590
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(router): adjust setting navigationTransition when a new navigatio‚Ä¶" (#29636)

# üêû bug report

### Description
When `ngcc` runs on an internal library we fail with:
`@ContentChildren predicate cannot be interpreted`

It's having an issue with:
```
_radios: [{ type: core.ContentChildren, args: [core.forwardRef(( /**
                                     * @return {?}
                                     */function () { return AlloyRadio; })), { descendants: true },] }]
```

which I think is related to the closure compiler (out side my wheelhouse now).  If I manually convert to:

```
_radios: [{ type: core.ContentChildren, args: [core.forwardRef(function () { return AlloyRadio; }), { descendants: true },] }],
```

it works.  Any ideas?

## üåç  Your Environment

**Angular Version:**
```
@angular-devkit/architect          0.800.0-beta.10
@angular-devkit/build-angular      0.800.0-beta.10
@angular-devkit/build-ng-packagr   0.800.0-beta.10
@angular-devkit/build-optimizer    0.800.0-beta.10

ng-packagr                         4.7.1
rxjs                               6.4.0

```

Issues.Title: RouterLinkBackHref directive
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ feature request

### Relevant Package
This feature request is for `@angular/router`


### Description
A new directive for `anchor` tag which navigates back to previous route.
Directive should allow opening previous route in new tab on `ctrl+click`

Added bonus: developers just need to add this directive to enable back without any code changes in component



### Describe the solution you'd like

1. The directive must set correct `href` to previous route
2. Should **not** push previous route into *history* API, but should pop last route


### Describe alternatives you've considered
`Location` from `@angular/common` provides `back` method but it is not that versatile
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "RouterLinkBackHref directive" (#29631)

Issues.Title: Angular Service worker not sending file in 'body' in POST request sometimes
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report
Angular Service worker is not sending file in 'body' in POST request sometimes. It works almost all the time, but, once in a while, I see that the POST request is sent with no file in body. When this happens, it continues to not send the body even after refreshing and disabling the cache. To resolve the issue, I open Application tab in dev tools, and stop and start the service worker, and it starts working, it starts sending file in 'body' for POST request.

### Affected Package
"@angular/service-worker": "^6.1.0"

## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction
I made a simple reproduction, but as I mentioned earlier, it is not reproducible everytime. So, please take some time for me and follow the steps below.

I observed that the problem happens when sending a file (not sure if it happens with any request.'body')

Open https://reproduction.stackbox.xyz/ and select any file. If the backend receives file, browser will display that. If backend does not receive the file, it will display that and this is the issue that we are trying to make it happen. The backend just checks if the file has come and throws if the file is not received.

Reproduction Steps:

- Open the above link, upload any file, you will most probably see that "File was sent successfully".

- Close the tab.

- Now comes the tricky part, Open the link again after an hour, and try uploading a file again. The issue will most probably happen. (It should say 'File not received'. If the issue happens, open the network tab and try uploading a file again, and the issue will happen again. We can see that the request sent by service worker has no body/file. Now, restart the service worker in Application tab, and the issue disappears.)

## üåç  Your Environment
"@angular/service-worker": "^6.1.0"
"@angular/core": "^6.1.0"
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Angular Service worker not sending file in 'body' in POST request sometimes" (#29629)

Issues.Title: NGCC Error: Node does not exist
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package @angular/compiler-cli ### Is this a regression? No ### Description `Node does not exist` error is thrown by `NGCC` when a direct or transitive dependency of a module that is being processed is missing. For example in the reproduction, when trying to process `@angular/material/progress-bar` it is failing, because this depends on `@angular/material/core`, and the later on `@angular/cdk`. But `@angular/cdk` is not installed. The error itself is not self explanatory and might send users on a goose chase. Hence, we should handle missing dependencies more gracefully and hint the users which is the missing dependency. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction https://github.com/alan-agius4/ngcc-node-error/tree/master ## üî• Exception or Error

Issues.Title: feat(@angular-devkit/build-angular): write index.html for differentia‚Ä¶
Issues.Body:
‚Ä¶l loading

Currently, the IndexHtmlWebpackPlugin generates the index.html file *during* bundling. However, to support differential loading the builder must do this *after* bundling because only then we know the produced files for ES5, ES2015, etc.
Hence, this extracts the IndexHtmlWebpackPlugin logic to a helper function which can still be called by IndexHtmlWebpackPlugin for use cases not affected by differential loading (e. g. ng serve) as well as directly by the builder.
https://docs.google.com/document/d/13k84oGwrEjwPyAiAjUgaaM7YHJrzYXz7Cbt6CwRp9N4/edit?ts=5c652052
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(@angular-devkit/build-angular): write index.html for differentia‚Ä¶" (#14045)

Issues.Title: Typescript Support in `ng lint` via `tsnode`
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ Feature request


### Command (mark with an `x`)
```
- [x] lint
```

### Description
As a developer, I would like to define custom `tslint` rules in Typescript without requiring subsequent compilation to javascript with `tsc`. Manually compiling to javascript forces another unnecessary step, which just slows down my development process. This is supported in `tslint@5.7.0` with `tsnode`, so I would hope this would be fairly straightforward and may only require a documentation change.

### Describe the solution you'd like
Ideally, I'd be able to write my rule, update my `rulesDirectory` in `tslint.json` and have `tslint` pick up my rule automatically.


### Describe alternatives you've considered

Issues.Title: Protractor, WebDriver chain maxes out at ChromeDriver 2.46 not compatible with Chrome 73
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) ``` - [ ] new - [ ] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ X] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ``` ### Is this a regression? Not related. ### Description Protractor version 5.4.2 leads to max ChromeDriver 2.46 While the latest Chrome version is 74 (minus 1 is 73) they are not compatible with ChromeDriver version 2.46. (side point Canary is exception). Not sure if the bug belongs to angular-cli but our version 7.x.x maxes out at ChromeDriver 2.46 and we have latest Chrome browser version on our machines/test servers which leads into some incompatibility issues. Bigger issue is Protractor's next version is 6 and that has breaking changes i.e. no control flow and must use async-await. I am already using async-await with disabled `SELENIUM_PROMISE_MANAGER: false` it seems the ChromeDriver 2.46 incompatibility with Chrome 73 may have made my e2e tests flaky. Especially that `browser.wait(ExpectedConditions.xxxxxxxx)` don't seem to work. TL;DR; Chrome jumped the gun ditching protractor, webdriver-manager, CLI. TBF protractor has 6.0 and webdriver-manager has 13.0 which is probably ready for Chrome 73 and above however Angular CLI is at 7.3.7 (and even the 8.beta) versions give us last protractor version of 5.4.2 https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/4dd6d3357d57e07ccd7243ce7be953f5aacb39de/packages/schematics/angular/workspace/files/package.json.template#L42 ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction ## üî• Exception or Error ## üåç Your Environment

Issues.Body: The stable API only exists in 8.0+.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "test(@angular-devkit/build-angular): use experimental API For rebuild barrel test" (#14028)

Issues.Title: Update JSON schema references
Issues.Body: Currently many of the schemas reference `http://json-schema.org/schema` which points to the latest version of the schema and will change over time.  It currently points to the `draft-07` version which allows everything to work for now.  However, there is no guarantee that the latest version will be supported by the CLI nor that the file will conform to the latest version.  By specifying a specific version, the `$schema` identifier can be used as both a version identifier for the format of the file and as the location of the schema.  This allows processors to use the specified version/format of the specification when parsing and processing the file.  (ref: http://json-schema.org/draft-07/json-schema-core.html#rfc.section.7)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Update JSON schema references" (#14030)

Issues.Title: Schema validation failed with the following errors:   Data path "" should NOT have additional properties(serve).
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report

### Command (mark with an `x`)
<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are effected by this bug? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: -->
```
- [ ] new
- [ ] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [x ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc
```

### Description

I want to run e2e test, the test works fine, but it keeps on loading the angular server each time, in order to avoid that, I want to run the test without running the serve. Hence wrote this

```
"e2e": {
          "builder": "@angular-devkit/build-angular:protractor",
          "options": {
            "protractorConfig": "./protractor.conf.js",
          },
          "configurations": {
            "staging": {
              "serve": false,
              "devServerTarget": "angular2-express-starter:serve:dev-staging"
            }
          }
        },
```
But after this if I run `ng e2e --configuration=staging` I get the error as 
`
Schema validation failed with the following errors:
  Data path "" should NOT have additional properties(serve).
`

## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction
Simple steps to reproduce this bug.

Adding `serve` in options of e2e in `angular.json` file
Then running ng e2e



## üåç Environment
Package                           Version
-----------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect         0.12.3
@angular-devkit/build-angular     0.12.3
@angular-devkit/build-optimizer   0.12.3
@angular-devkit/build-webpack     0.12.3
@angular-devkit/core              7.2.3
@angular-devkit/schematics        7.3.7
@angular/cli                      7.3.7
@ngtools/webpack                  7.2.3
@schematics/angular               7.3.7
@schematics/update                0.13.7
rxjs                              6.3.3
typescript                        3.2.4
webpack                           4.28.4
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Schema validation failed with the following errors:   Data path "" should NOT have additional properties(serve)." (#14021)

Issues.Title: Use MatAutocomple without MatInput
Issues.Body:
I want to use MatAutocomplete on a bootstrap-styled input. Unfortunately, being able to use MatAutocomplete requires surrounding the input with a mat-form-field and giving the input itself a matInput-directive.

I was wondering if it is possible to avoid using
- mat-form-field
- matInput
- or at least use them in a "headless-mode" so they handle things like focus and model change subscriptions, but do not edit the template

The original mat-input is just too big and too interactive for many use cases. I am sure many people would like to replace it's style.

By the way, if the matInput directive is missing, you get the very misleading message

```
UiBootstrapSearchComponent.html:8 ERROR Error: mat-form-field must contain a MatFormFieldControl.
    at getMatFormFieldMissingControlError (form-field.es5.js:119)
    at MatFormField.push.../../node_modules/@angular/material/esm5/form-field.es5.js.MatFormField._validateControlChild (form-field.es5.js:771)
    at MatFormField.push.../../node_modules/@angular/material/esm5/form-field.es5.js.MatFormField.ngAfterContentInit (form-field.es5.js:453)
    at callProviderLifecycles (core.js:22409)
    at callElementProvidersLifecycles (core.js:22390)
    at callLifecycleHooksChildrenFirst (core.js:22380)
    at checkAndUpdateView (core.js:23311)
    at callViewAction (core.js:23548)
    at execComponentViewsAction (core.js:23490)
    at checkAndUpdateView (core.js:23313)
```
even though it is matInput and not [formControl] missing
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Use MatAutocomple without MatInput" (#15684)

Issues.Title: MatIconRegistry cannot find icon with special id
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?
The `MatIconRegistry` returns the correct icon using `MatIconRegistry._extractSvgIconFromSet`.

#### What is the current behavior?
`MatIconRegistry._extractSvgIconFromSet` cannot find the icon due to an incorrect query selector.

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
Register a SVG icon set containing a SVG with id "icon-300 my icon"

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
Angular Material 5.1.0 and higher

#### Is there anything else we should know?
Currently the `MatIconRegistry` makes use of `iconSet.querySelector('#' + iconName)`:
https://github.com/angular/material2/blob/master/src/lib/icon/icon-registry.ts#L452

Instead it should be using `iconSet.getElementById(iconName)`
Then in my case it returns the correct SVG element.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "MatIconRegistry cannot find icon with special id" (#15673)

Issues.Title: mat-select violates legibility guidelines
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?

Text colors should be chosen consistently to have good contrast with application background.  
#### What is the current behavior?

The selected option in the dropdown of a `mat-select` uses the theme's primary color as text color.

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
Open any (non-customized) select control on [the docs page](https://material.angular.io/components/select/overview).  Change the demo site's themes and observe that the selected item's text color matches the app bar.

For the Blue light theme, it is difficult to tell the primary color (dark blue) from the non-selected items (black).  Worse, with the purple dark theme, there is little contrast between the purple primary color and the light gray option-list background.

[This contrast calculation](https://snook.ca/technical/colour_contrast/colour.html#fg=9C27B0,bg=424242) shows a contrast ratio of about 1.5; [the spec](https://material.io/design/color/text-legibility.html#legibility-standards) requires compliance with accessibility guidelines including contrast of 4.5.

#### Is there anything else we should know?

I'm not positive how to best solve this.  I went looking for a spec to consult but I can't seem to find any description of a Select component in the current Material documentation, so there's no guidance about what color to "pick" for showing selected state.  Ideally you'd always use a text color that's defined as `contrast` in a palette.  Maybe selection state should be conveyed by text weight instead of changing color? As far as I can tell, the `mat-select` is the only component that uses `primary` as a text color (instead of a control or block/background color).

You could tell designers to always pick a primary that contrasts well with the theme background (light/dark) but this would pretty severely limit the available colors we can use and invalidates a lot of the popular themes, including some of the default ones.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "mat-select violates legibility guidelines" (#15672)

Issues.Title: fix(datepicker): screen reader reading out role twice
Issues.Body: Currently the markup of the calendar is `div[role="grid"] > table > td[role="gridcell"]`. Because we've got both a `grid` and a `table`, NVDA ends up reading out something like "Dialog, table, table, 31st of March 2019, column X, row Y". These changes set the `table` to be a `presentation` role so that "table" is only read out once.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(datepicker): screen reader reading out role twice" (#15663)

Issues.Title: fix(datepicker): add focus indication in high contrast mode
Issues.Body: Fixes the datepicker calendar not having focus indication in high contrast mode, making it difficult to navigate using the keyboard.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(datepicker): add focus indication in high contrast mode" (#15661)

Issues.Title: fix(drag-drop): don't allow user to move item into container that isn't connected to current one by passing it over an intermediate one that is
Issues.Body:
In a setup like `Container 1 <-> Container 2 <-> Container 3` the user shouldn't be allowed to move items between containers 1 and 3, because they're not connected. This is currently possible if the user passes it through container 2 first. These changes rework the logic so that this is no longer possible.

Fixes #15191.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(drag-drop): don't allow user to move item into container that isn't connected to current one by passing it over an intermediate one that is" (#15660)
